By Ruiner on Friday, December 14, 2001 - 01:41 pm:

Combining two monsters to have all the Hi-Traits combined will eliminate all of them and give Gold Gift. This is verified but takes some work.

By sonicnova on Saturday, December 15, 2001 - 05:00 am:

Well, you all should know how to get gold gift. It is pretty simple. When you get all the items that gives you the hi-traits, put it on your monster and you simply just get the gold gift as a single trait without wasting your other traits space.

By John Hawley on Thursday, December 27, 2001 - 06:25 pm:

By Christopher on Friday, December 28, 2001 - 08:14 pm:

Ummm, I'm having a problem.

I have a Durahan with Hi-Tech and Hi-Resist, and a Tiger with Hi-Sence, Hi-Speed, Hi-Power, and Hi-Tough. But everytime I combine them I get a monster with Armor, Elec Resis, and 4 of the Hi characteristics. Anyone know if I'm doing anything wrong?

By John Hawley on Friday, December 28, 2001 - 10:51 pm:

Most monsters have a native trait (Durahan=Armor, Tiger=Elec Resis). People have reported that even if erased with the LetheRXs, these native traits will reappear in the combine.

In combining, your Main contributes the first trait on the new monster and your Sub the second and Native traits seem to have priority over others. Like so: Trait 1= Main 1, Trait 2= Sub 1 and so on.

So what's happening is that the Native traits are walking the last of the Hi-s off the board so that they don't combine to become Gold Gift (6 trait max, remember).

Offhand, I'd say combine with a monster like Zan that doesn't seem to have a Native trait first. Erase whatever you don't need, like Elec Resis, then combine that into your Durahan. Also, be sure and eliminate anything from the Durahan that you don't need like Hi-Resist. You must keep it under the six trait limit for Gold Gift to show up. And for a Durahan, Armor will always show up.

Once you have Gold Gift, you can use it to combine into anything you want, so long as it is high enough in the trait list to transfer.

By Lisa Shock on Saturday, December 29, 2001 - 01:05 am:

I managed to get it on an Antlan, after combinations involving a variety of monsters.

By John Hawley on Saturday, December 29, 2001 - 08:12 am:

It's still a guessing game for some traits. Also, it would help to know which monsters you were combining as some monsters can't inherit some traits. And we still don't know all the combos possible. More data please.

By _darkarchon on Saturday, December 29, 2001 - 11:56 am:

Hooray! I got a Roadroller with:

Gold Gift
Fairy Know
Iron Heart
Dusk Aura

If one combination doesn't work, try the opposite way. For example, during one combination in the process where I was combining two monsters, I got Earth Know, Elec-Proof and 4 of the Hi-Traits on a Ducken/Psiroller (I think). However, when I went the other way and got a Psiroller/Ducken, I got Gold Gift and Earth Know. If you combine A then B and it doesn't work, combine B then A.
